Phrase: There's a defensive line around here too, Karl.

Name: The brothers Karl and Emil is a reference to a novel about WW2 - Emil and Karl, Yankev Glatshteyn, 1940
Yes, Emil, it's too dangerous to continue on our way. There's nowhere to run if the enemies spot us.
That's because you're slow, Karl. I'd wish you'd could run a bit faster.
Yoshino, what do you think?
Suspiciousness max. They're talking about defensive lines and enemies.
They're too young to join the army or gendarmerie. Perhaps they're spies sent by some organisation.
Organisation, like the Resistance?
I don't know. But we can't just let them lurk around.
Hold it right there, you two. What are you doing here?
WHOA!? Enemy soldiers!
Karl, calm down! It's true that they're wearing military uniforms, but they're not the enemy.
I'm Yakutsk from the Eisengrad Army, she's Yoshino from the Nishiki Army, and we're patrolling the area in cooperation with the Verforet Gendarmerie.
Oh, ooooh-?
Is that how it is this time?
Don't tell them we're members of the SSS yet. Just go with my flow.
Ryoukai.
Hello Yakutsk, I'm Karl, slow but steady, Emil's elder brother.
Hello Yoshino, I'm Emil, stubborn but speedy, Karl's younger brother.
And together, we are Karl and Emil!
Is Verforet full of silly people like this?
Why are you two hanging around here? Didn't you just say something about defensive lines and enemies?
Yeah, that's cause...
What should I do, Emil? How should I explain in this case?
That's where the brawny ones like you are lousy at. Leave it to me, I'll explain to them.
Yeah, I'll leave it to you.
So let me explain why we are lost in this strange place.
The way you talk sure doesn't sound like you're a child. As if you're used to negotiating.
Yakutsk, and Yoshino, I assure you we are not suspicious. It's true. We have no intention of misbehaving in this forest.

Actually, we were playing a game here. We were divided into two teams and we were playing capture the flag. This is the enemy team's defensive line. Karl and I wanted to sneak in and take the other team's flag.
But when we got into the forest, everything changed. There were trenches, pillboxes and Mist Monsters. We were walking around trying to get to safety, and we got more and more lost.
Regarding that, Yoshino and friends are still investigating. Don't know anything in detail.
If we can get to the west of the forest, we'll be able to find our papa and mama. But how can we head west while avoiding these trenches and pillboxes?
Wouldn't west be where the gendarmerie's station is located? From here, the safest route is to go around from the northern side of the forest.
If your otou-san and oka-san are waiting for you, you must go back quickly. Wait, will show you the map now.
That would be great. There are iron fortresses all the way to the south and to the west. We were wondering how to get around them.
Wait a minute? You said there are more fortresses further west from here?
Yes, there are. All the pillboxes in Ouvrage Fermont are intimidat...
Oh...
KARL!
Ya boys know a bit too much about these ruins. How do you know that these ruins are iron fortresses if you're simply lost? I'm quite sure no one else has been in here to investigate yet, you know?
Ugh, that's, I read about it in an old book at...
Where did you read that book? We have a girl in our group who's been reading every single book about Verforench ruins. Even that kid didn't know anything about these Iron Fortresses.
And, this Ouvrage Fermont you mentioned, its something that's never heard of before. Isn't this place called Schoenenbourg?
I see, so we're already at the Ouvrage Schoenenbourg...
Emil, snatch the map! We're going to turn around from the north and head west, just like these girls said!
Yeah, now we can break through the defensive line!
Ah, Yoshino's map!
I'm not letting you get away! We're taking you both into custody!
No way. You won't be able to catch us.
Don't ya dare underestimate me! Don't ya dare bunch me together with those ordinary soldiers...
Impossible!? I'm very sure I grabbed...
Farewell then, Yakutsk and Yoshino, I'm happy that you two are the only ones we've met. Thanks to you, we didn't have to waste time fighting.
Thanks for the map. You girls are very kind. As a small thank you, I'll tell you a way out of here.

The most terrifying part of Ouvrage Schoenenbourg is the Minecart Graveyard, if you get trapped there, look for the steel floorboards. You should be able to get out through the vents to the fortress ammunition store.
Hmhmm... Be careful of the minecarts inside the fortress.
Tch, those twerps weren't human...
Nee Yakutsk, aren't you and Yoshino in trouble by any chance?
Seems like it. Gonna be tough for the two of us alone to break through.
Yoshino, two whistles!
Ryoukai! Phantom Mist hassai, requesting reinforcements!
Vivienne
Queensway
Phrase: Reinforcements requested. We all need to go now!

Name: Queensway
Phrase: There's Phantom Mist inside the ruins too! Are these ruins the source of the Phantom Mist after all?

Name: Vivienne
Phrase: But there's a very thick Mist in the forest, Yakutsk and Yoshino can't hold it alone.
